result.headline: A Romance Tested by Fire and Other Calamities
result.summary: Nico De Rosa had just left his first meeting with Laurie Smolenski when a minivan slammed into his Vespa. That was just the first calamity.

caption.full: Laurie Smolenski, 31, and Nico De Rosa, 35,  walking east on the Williamsburg Bridge. Mr. De Rosa had an accident on his Vespa on the bridge the night he met Ms. Smolenski.
caption.short: Laurie Smolenski, 31, and Nico De Rosa, 35, walking east on the Williamsburg Bridge.

print_information.edition: The New York Times on the Web

article.body:
Blood was spilling from cuts on his back and arms, his Vespa was a twist of metal and plastic, his mind was woozy and emergency personnel were swarming the scene.

But in the minutes after a minivan had slammed into him on the Williamsburg Bridge, all Nico De Rosa could think about was his destroyed cellphone — and how he was going to recover the phone number of the woman he had just met.

It was the night of Aug. 24, 2012. Several hours earlier, he had first seen Laurie Smolenski at a wine tasting in a wine shop in NoLIta.

She was working as a clerk at the store. He was working for the distributor providing the wines for the tasting. Each had given notice at their respective jobs and each had considered not going to work that night.

Ms. Smolenski, now 31, was overcome with mixed feelings when she saw Mr. De Rosa, who is Italian-American, arrive on his Vespa that evening and walk into the shop. He was “so handsome” with “golden skin,” she recalled. “I could barely string a sentence together.” But for reasons she still can’t fully explain, she thought she wasn’t going to like him.

“He initially struck me as very cocky,” she recalled the other day.

“I get that a lot,” he said.

Meanwhile, Mr. De Rosa’s reaction upon seeing Ms. Smolenski — who is petite with a blond pixie cut — was unambiguous. “I walked in and was, like, wow,” he said. “I couldn’t take my eyes off her.”

Ms. Smolenski warmed up when Mr. De Rosa helped her with a box of wines she was carrying up from the cellar. “It was a little shift in this intimidatingly handsome man who lent himself to this thoughtful gesture,” she said.

There weren’t many customers, so they pulled two chairs close and began to talk, discovering overlapping pasts and shared interests. They were both from the Midwest — Ms. Smolenski from Grosse Pointe, Mich., Mr. De Rosa from Munster, Ind.; both liked to travel; both had studied at the same language institute in Rome.

“I always think coincidences are interesting not only in their occurrence but that you learn of them,” Ms. Smolenski said.

“It was very easy to open myself up to Laurie,” Mr. De Rosa, 35, said. “I’m like, I can see myself with this person.” He added: “New York is not an easy city to find someone in — a partner, a friend, even an acquaintance. Everyone is so busy.”

Mr. De Rosa stayed well after the wine tasting was over. Customers, thinking they were a couple, asked how long they had owned the shop. Mr. De Rosa helped Ms. Smolenski close up. Then — hamstrung by shyness, he said — he asked her out “in a roundabout way,” inviting her to explore Brooklyn on his scooter someday.

She had no time for vagueness.

“I’m going to Spain in a couple of days,” she told him. “Who knows what’s going to happen? Let’s get together tomorrow.”

Mr. De Rosa snapped to attention and said he would pick her up the next evening.

Minutes later, en route to his apartment in Williamsburg, he found himself at a traffic light on Delancey Street, side by side with a minivan, whose driver was pelting him with expletives and honking the horn. Mr. De Rosa says he had no idea what had ticked off the driver. Still, when the light changed, Mr. De Rosa gave the driver the middle finger and accelerated toward the Williamsburg Bridge.

On the bridge, the driver quickly changed lanes, apparently to drop in behind Mr. De Rosa, but plowed into the median wall. As the van spun around, it sideswiped the Vespa, ejecting Mr. De Rosa.

Mr. De Rosa was banged up but able to move. He ran to the side of the road and pulled his damaged phone from his pocket.

“I thought: ‘Oh, no. She’s going to think I blew her off.’”

The next day, he sent an email to the manager of the wine store, who passed the message along to Ms. Smolenski.

“I imagined he was in the hospital,” Ms. Smolenski recalled. “Could I go see him? Would I ever see him again?”

They had dinner the next night at Via Tribunali, a Neapolitan pizza restaurant on the Lower East Side, and picked up the conversation where they left off. Mr. De Rosa said almost nothing about the accident, which impressed Ms. Smolenski. “He just seemed really tough,” she recalled.

During the conversation, Mr. De Rosa, in a burst of honesty, revealed that he was unable to have children. “That’s awesome!” Ms. Smolenski replied. “I’ve never wanted to give birth.”

They ended up at her apartment that night and she dressed his wounds.

When Ms. Smolenski returned from Spain later in the summer, Mr. De Rosa met her at the airport. “I remember Nico picking up this giant suitcase and putting it on his shoulder,” she said. “I remember looking at his butt. I remember thinking, ‘Who is this guy?’”

He took her straight to his apartment, where he made her dinner. He drove her to work in the morning on a newly purchased used Vespa — Ms. Smolenski was now working full time at the Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement House in Long Island City, Queens, where she did advocacy work for immigrants. They spent the next several weeks inhaling New York, including outings to Brighton Beach and picnics in McCarren Park (with exquisite wine).

In the late spring of 2013, calamity struck again. They were asleep one night in Mr. De Rosa’s third-floor apartment when Ms. Smolenski awoke to the smell of something burning. Mr. De Rosa said she was only dreaming. But smoke was spewing from an exhaust vent from the Dominican bodega on the first floor and slithering between the floorboards of the apartment.

They alerted Mr. De Rosa’s roommates, and Ms. Smolenski grabbed her phone and a slip and bolted down the smoke-filled staircase. As Mr. De Rosa followed, he lost his footing on the stairs and fell hard, rupturing a disk in his back, an injury that would require surgery.

But where Mr. De Rosa’s previous mishap marked a crescendo of passion for the couple, this one signaled the start of a slow downward arc.

Mr. De Rosa was forced to vacate his apartment — the fire had destroyed the building — and he and his dog, Sofia, a pit bull mutt, moved in with Ms. Smolenski and her three roommates, who had just relocated to a new three-bedroom, one-bathroom apartment. “It was really tight,” she said.

Her room didn’t have a closet, and their belongings were piled high on the floor. “It felt like living in a cave,” she said. “I’m really claustrophobic.”

In addition, the apartment was right above a bar, keeping them up at night. Garbage trucks collecting the trash outside their window woke them up in the morning.

Mr. De Rosa had back surgery in June 2013, heaping additional pressure on the couple. “I was psychologically not in my element,” Ms. Smolenski said. “He was physically uncomfortable.” The second summer of their relationship was turning into “a complete nightmare,” she said.

They decided to look for an apartment of their own. But what might have been a romantic, restorative time together was instead full of anxiety. Ms. Smolenski was working long hours at her job, so the apartment search fell largely to Mr. De Rosa, who was still mending and hobbled.

“Apartment searching sucked,” Ms. Smolenski said.

In July, they moved into a small apartment on Prince Street in SoHo, but they had a hard time regaining their blissful pre-fire footing. Among the stresses of their life, Mr. De Rosa’s father disclosed to them in October of that year that he had inoperable lung cancer and died two weeks later.

“We kind of hit, as a couple, rock bottom, basically due to different communication styles,” Mr. De Rosa said. “I was basically at a point where I didn’t know who I was or what I was. It put our relationship on death row.”

Mr. De Rosa started psychotherapy. They discussed breaking up.

Now, at the start of a new summer, they said they hoped the season would refortify them.

“This summer is going to be ——” Mr. De Rosa began during an interview early in June. He paused to search for the right adjective.

“Calamity-free?” suggested Ms. Smolenski, now the development manager at the New York Immigration Coalition.

A week and a half later, however, Mr. De Rosa was riding a CitiBike down West Broadway when he hit a pothole and found himself airborne once again. He landed hard on his side and smashed his face against the asphalt. The crash left him bloody and bruised.

“The first thing I thought of was her,” he said. “It was a complete flashback to the day I met her.” This time his phone worked.

100000003750492.headline: Summer Love
100000003750492.summary: Articles in this series are exploring romance in New York in the hot season.

interactivegraphics.leadin: Articles in this series are exploring romance in New York in the hot season.

100000003756378.headline: Your Best or Worst Summer Dates in New York City
100000003756378.summary: What was your best — or worst — summer date in New York City? This summer, we’re exploring love in the hot season, and love often starts with a date. We want to know about yours.

.leaflet-label:after {
  border-top: 6px solid transparent;
  border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
  content: none;
  position: absolute;
  top: 5px;
}
.leaflet-label:before {
  border-right: 6px solid black;
  border-right-color: inherit;
  left: -10px;
}
.leaflet-label:after {
  border-left: 6px solid black;
  border-left-color: inherit;
  right: -10px;
}
.leaflet-label-right:before,
.leaflet-label-left:after {
  content: "";
}

  float: left;
  font-family: "nyt-franklin", arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
  padding-right: 100px;
}
.g-form .g-intro-text b {
  font-size: 0.85em;
  font-weight: 700;
  text-transform: uppercase;
}

  color: #666;
}

  display: inline-block;
}
.g-form .g-form-marker-container {
  display: block;
  height: 100%;
  float: right;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  position: absolute;
  right: 0;
  -webkit-transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
  -ms-transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
  width: 90px;
}
.g-form .g-form-marker {
  background-image: url(http://graphics8.nytimes.com/newsgraphics/2014/06/10/summer-love-2/assets/hearts/neutral@2x.png);
  background-position: center center;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  background-size: 100% auto;
  left: 0;
  height: 90px;
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  width: 100px;
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-transition: -webkit-transform 250ms;
  transition: transform 250ms;
  -webkit-transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.04, 1, 0.575, 1);
  /* older webkit */
  -webkit-transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.04, 1.015, 0.575, 1.49);
  transition-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.04, 1.015, 0.575, 1.49);
  /* custom */
}
.g-form .g-form-marker#g-form-marker-happy {
  left: -40px;
}
.g-form .g-form-marker:hover {
  cursor: -webkit-grab, move;
  cursor: grab, move;
  cursor: -webkit-grab;
  -webkit-transform: rotateZ(-12.5deg);
  -ms-transform: rotateZ(-12.5deg);
  transform: rotateZ(-12.5deg);
}
.g-form .g-form-marker.twitch-1 {
  -webkit-transform: rotateZ(-5deg);
  -ms-transform: rotateZ(-5deg);
  transform: rotateZ(-5deg);
}
.g-form .g-form-marker.twitch-2 {
  -webkit-transform: rotateZ(5deg);
  -ms-transform: rotateZ(5deg);
  transform: rotateZ(5deg);
}
.g-form .g-form-marker.twitch-3 {
  -webkit-transform: rotateZ(-2.5deg);
  -ms-transform: rotateZ(-2.5deg);
  transform: rotateZ(-2.5deg);
}
.g-form .g-form-marker:hover.dragging {
  cursor: -webkit-grabbing, move;
  cursor: grabbing, move;
  cursor: -webkit-grabbing;
  -webkit-transform: scale(0.65) rotateZ(-2.5deg);
  -ms-transform: scale(0.65) rotateZ(-2.5deg);
  transform: scale(0.65) rotateZ(-2.5deg);
  opacity: 0.55;
}
.g-form .g-form-control {
  padding: 15px 15px 18px 15px;
  margin: 23px 0 8px 0;
  background-color: #fcfcfc;
  border: 1px solid #ddd;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.075);
  line-height: 1;
  font: 500 14px / 1 nyt-franklin, arial, sans-serif;

                    <div class="g-item"
                         id="s-1TuMTt-QReOTK81SAdE_3w">

                        <div class="g-blurb">
                            <h2>Never Again Will I Date a Columbia Student</h2>
                            <div class="g-contributor">By <span class="g-contributor-name">Sean Paus</span></div>
                            <div class="g-blurb-text">
                                <p>
                                    I've been on quite a few dates before and not once have I had a good date with someone who goes to school at Columbia University. However this date took takes the gold in bad dates. He comes in an hour late, never apologizes, and continues to brag about how his life is so cultured. As he continues to talk about his oh-so sophisticated life, I can't help but stare at the food stuck in his teeth.  He doesn't pick up the check and I end up paying for his $20 appetizer. I'll stick with NYU guys.
                                </p>
                            </div>

                            <div
                                class="g-sharetools"
                                data-url=""
                                data-title=""
                                data-description=""
                                data-shares="facebook|Facebook,twitter|Twitter" ></div>

                        </div>
                    </div>

                    

                

                    <div class="g-item"
                         id="s-25N4R89zS1WcvQb72sWOtg">

                        <div class="g-blurb">
                            <h2>Broken Apart and Mended Back Together</h2>
                            <div class="g-contributor">By <span class="g-contributor-name">Emily</span></div>
                            <div class="g-blurb-text">
                                <p>
                                    After a NY summer together, we ended it here in Union Square.  He was off for a job in San Francisco and I was off for my last year of school.  I left him with a love letter, which he reciprocated 4 months later, reigniting our relationship.  This summer is our second together in NY and marks the end of our long-distance relationship that started 4 months after our Union Square breakup.
                                </p>
                            </div>

                            <div
                                class="g-sharetools"
                                data-url=""
                                data-title=""
                                data-description=""
                                data-shares="facebook|Facebook,twitter|Twitter" ></div>

                    <div class="g-item"

                        <div class="g-blurb">
                            <h2>College Study Break  </h2>
                            <div class="g-contributor">By <span class="g-contributor-name">Amanda</span></div>
                            <div class="g-blurb-text">
                                <p>
                                    After getting my AIM screenname off of my profile on "nyu.thefacebook.com," he finally convinced me to (begrudgingly) meet him in person (...in my dorm room). He (6'3") turned out to be taller than I am (6'1"), so I decided to give him a chance after all. That was 11 years ago. (We're married now.)
                                </p>
                            </div>

                            <div
                                class="g-sharetools"

                                data-title=""
                                data-description=""
                                data-shares="facebook|Facebook,twitter|Twitter" ></div>

                        </div>

                    <div class="g-item"
                         id="s-TcHdk4V5SFCdWHwlVQ5enw">

                        <div class="g-blurb">
                            <h2>Artistic Bust</h2>
                            <div class="g-contributor">By <span class="g-contributor-name">Ana</span></div>
                            <div class="g-blurb-text">
                                <p>
                                    It was scorching, and my date from N.J. was running about an hour late. I guess that's karma for you. We went to the MET; he was an art major. He admitted to walking from Port Authority on 41st. I politely hinted that he use the restroom as he was sweating from head to toe. He declined, so I made sure not to go near him. I knew more about the exhibits than him. After, he suggested to this native New Yorker we go to Olive Garden aka a tourist trap. Waiting some more, we ate and parted.
                                </p>
                            </div>

                            <div

.leaflet-layer {
  position: absolute;
  left: 0;
  top: 0;
}
.leaflet-container {
  overflow: hidden;
  -ms-touch-action: none;
}
.leaflet-tile,
.leaflet-marker-icon,
.leaflet-marker-shadow {
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  -webkit-user-drag: none;
}
.leaflet-marker-icon,
.leaflet-marker-shadow {
  display: block;
}
.g-hide-for-anim {
  visibility: hidden;
}
.leaflet-marker-draggable.g-hide-for-anim {
  visibility: visible;
}
/* map is broken in FF if you have max-width: 100% on tiles */
.leaflet-container img {
  max-width: none !important;
}
/* stupid Android 2 doesn't understand "max-width: none" properly */
.leaflet-container img.leaflet-image-layer {
  max-width: 15000px !important;
}
.leaflet-tile {
  -webkit-filter: inherit;
  filter: inherit;
  visibility: hidden;
}
.leaflet-tile-loaded {
  visibility: inherit;
}
.leaflet-zoom-box {
  width: 0;
  height: 0;
}
/* workaround for https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=888319 */
.leaflet-overlay-pane svg {
  -moz-user-select: none;
}
.leaflet-tile-pane {
  z-index: 2;
}
.leaflet-objects-pane {
  z-index: 3;
}
.leaflet-overlay-pane {
  z-index: 4;
}
.leaflet-shadow-pane {
  z-index: 5;
}
.leaflet-marker-pane {
  z-index: 6;
}
.leaflet-popup-pane {
  z-index: 7;
}
.leaflet-vml-shape {
  width: 1px;
  height: 1px;
}
.lvml {
  behavior: url(#default#VML);
  display: inline-block;
  position: absolute;
}
/* control positioning */
.leaflet-control {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 7;
  pointer-events: auto;
}
.leaflet-top,
.leaflet-bottom {
  position: absolute;
  z-index: 1000;
  pointer-events: none;
}
.leaflet-top {
  top: 0;
}
.leaflet-right {
  right: 0;
}
.leaflet-bottom {
  bottom: 0;
}
.leaflet-left {
  left: 0;
}
.leaflet-control {
  float: left;
  clear: both;
}
.leaflet-right .leaflet-control {
  float: right;
}
.leaflet-top .leaflet-control {
  margin-top: 10px;
}
.leaflet-bottom .leaflet-control {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
.leaflet-left .leaflet-control {
  margin-left: 10px;
}
.leaflet-right .leaflet-control {
  margin-right: 10px;
}
/* zoom and fade animations */
.leaflet-fade-anim .leaflet-tile,
.leaflet-fade-anim .leaflet-popup {
  opacity: 0;
  -webkit-transition: opacity 0.2s linear;
  transition: opacity 0.2s linear;
}
.leaflet-fade-anim .leaflet-tile-loaded,
.leaflet-fade-anim .leaflet-map-pane .leaflet-popup {
  opacity: 1;
}
.leaflet-zoom-anim .leaflet-zoom-animated {
  -webkit-transition: -webkit-transform 0.25s cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.25, 1);
  transition: transform 0.25s cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.25, 1);
}
.leaflet-zoom-anim .leaflet-tile,
.leaflet-pan-anim .leaflet-tile,
.leaflet-touching .leaflet-zoom-animated {
  -webkit-transition: none;
  transition: none;
}
.leaflet-zoom-anim .leaflet-zoom-hide {
  visibility: hidden;
}
/* cursors */
.leaflet-clickable {
  cursor: pointer;
}
.leaflet-container {
  cursor: -webkit-grab;
  cursor: -moz-grab;
}
.leaflet-popup-pane,
.leaflet-control {
  cursor: auto;
}
.leaflet-dragging .leaflet-container,
.leaflet-dragging .leaflet-clickable {
  cursor: move;
  cursor: -webkit-grabbing;
  cursor: -moz-grabbing;
}
/* visual tweaks */
.leaflet-container {
  background: #ddd;
  outline: 0;
}
.leaflet-container a {
  color: #0078A8;
}
.leaflet-container a.leaflet-active {
  outline: 2px solid orange;
}
.leaflet-zoom-box {
  border: 2px dotted #38f;
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
}
/* general typography */
.leaflet-container {
  font: 12px/1.5 Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif;
}
/* general toolbar styles */
.leaflet-bar {
  box-shadow: 0 1px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.65);
  border-radius: 4px;
}
.leaflet-bar a,
.leaflet-bar a:hover {
  background-color: #fff;
  border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc;
  width: 26px;
  height: 26px;
  line-height: 26px;
  display: block;
  text-align: center;
  text-decoration: none;
  color: black;
}
.leaflet-bar a,
.leaflet-control-layers-toggle {
  background-position: 50% 50%;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  display: block;
}
.leaflet-bar a:hover {
  background-color: #f4f4f4;
}
.leaflet-bar a:first-child {
  border-top-left-radius: 4px;
  border-top-right-radius: 4px;
}
.leaflet-bar a:last-child {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 4px;
  border-bottom-right-radius: 4px;
  border-bottom: none;
}
.leaflet-bar a.leaflet-disabled {
  cursor: default;
  background-color: #f4f4f4;
  color: #bbb;
}
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-bar a {
  width: 30px;
  height: 30px;
  line-height: 30px;
}
/* zoom control */
.leaflet-control-zoom-in,
.leaflet-control-zoom-out {
  font: bold 18px 'Lucida Console', Monaco, monospace;
  text-indent: 1px;
}
.leaflet-control-zoom-out {
  font-size: 20px;
}
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-control-zoom-in {
  font-size: 22px;
}
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-control-zoom-out {
  font-size: 24px;
}
/* layers control */
.leaflet-control-layers {
  box-shadow: 0 1px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  background: #fff;
  border-radius: 5px;
}
.leaflet-control-layers-toggle {
  background-image: url(images/layers.png);
  width: 36px;
  height: 36px;
}
.leaflet-retina .leaflet-control-layers-toggle {
  background-image: url(images/layers-2x.png);
  background-size: 26px 26px;
}
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-control-layers-toggle {
  width: 44px;
  height: 44px;
}
.leaflet-control-layers .leaflet-control-layers-list,
.leaflet-control-layers-expanded .leaflet-control-layers-toggle {
  display: none;
}
.leaflet-control-layers-expanded .leaflet-control-layers-list {
  display: block;
  position: relative;
}
.leaflet-control-layers-expanded {
  padding: 6px 10px 6px 6px;
  color: #333;
  background: #fff;
}
.leaflet-control-layers-selector {
  margin-top: 2px;
  position: relative;
  top: 1px;
}
.leaflet-control-layers label {
  display: block;
}
.leaflet-control-layers-separator {
  height: 0;
  border-top: 1px solid #ddd;
  margin: 5px -10px 5px -6px;
}
/* attribution and scale controls */
.leaflet-container .leaflet-control-attribution {
  background: #fff;
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7);
  margin: 0;
}
.leaflet-control-attribution,
.leaflet-control-scale-line {
  padding: 0 5px;
  color: #333;
}
.leaflet-control-attribution a {
  text-decoration: none;
}
.leaflet-control-attribution a:hover {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.leaflet-container .leaflet-control-attribution,
.leaflet-container .leaflet-control-scale {
  font-size: 11px;
}
.leaflet-left .leaflet-control-scale {
  margin-left: 5px;
}
.leaflet-bottom .leaflet-control-scale {
  margin-bottom: 5px;
}
.leaflet-control-scale-line {
  border: 2px solid #777;
  border-top: none;
  line-height: 1.1;
  padding: 2px 5px 1px;
  font-size: 11px;
  white-space: nowrap;
  overflow: hidden;
  box-sizing: content-box;
  background: #fff;
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
}
.leaflet-control-scale-line:not(:first-child) {
  border-top: 2px solid #777;
  border-bottom: none;
  margin-top: -2px;
}
.leaflet-control-scale-line:not(:first-child):not(:last-child) {
  border-bottom: 2px solid #777;
}
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-control-attribution,
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-control-layers,
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-bar {
  box-shadow: none;
}
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-control-layers,
.leaflet-touch .leaflet-bar {
  border: 2px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  background-clip: padding-box;
}
/* popup */
.leaflet-popup {
  position: absolute;
  text-align: center;
  pointer-events: none;
}
.leaflet-popup-content-wrapper {
  padding: 1px;
  text-align: left;
  border-radius: 1px;
}
.leaflet-popup-content {
  margin: 14px;
  line-height: 1.4;
}
.leaflet-popup-content p {
  margin: 18px 0;
}
.leaflet-popup-tip-container {
  margin: 0 auto;
  width: 40px;
  height: 20px;
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
}
.leaflet-popup-tip {
  width: 10px;
  height: 10px;
  padding: 1px;
  margin: -5px auto 0;
  -webkit-transform: rotate(45deg);
  -ms-transform: rotate(45deg);
  transform: rotate(45deg);
}
.leaflet-popup-content-wrapper,
.leaflet-popup-tip {
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.85);
  box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25);
}
.leaflet-container a.leaflet-popup-close-button {
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  right: 0;
  padding: 7px;
  text-align: center;
  width: 18px;
  height: 14px;
  font: 16px/14px Tahoma, Verdana, sans-serif;
  color: #e5e5e5;
  text-decoration: none;
  font-weight: bold;
  background: transparent;
}
.leaflet-container a.leaflet-popup-close-button:hover {
  color: #999;
}
.leaflet-popup-scrolled {
  overflow: auto;
  border-bottom: 1px solid #ddd;
  border-top: 1px solid #ddd;
}
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-popup-content-wrapper {
  zoom: 1;
}
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-popup-tip {
  width: 24px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  -ms-filter: "progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.Matrix(M11=0.70710678, M12=0.70710678, M21=-0.70710678, M22=0.70710678)";
  filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.Matrix(M11=0.70710678, M12=0.70710678, M21=-0.70710678, M22=0.70710678);
}
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-popup-tip-container {
  margin-top: -1px;
}
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-control-zoom,
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-control-layers,
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-popup-content-wrapper,
.leaflet-oldie .leaflet-popup-tip {
  border: 1px solid #999;
}
/* div icon */
.leaflet-div-icon {
  background: #fff;
  border: 1px solid #666;
}
/* leaflet overrides */
.leaflet-popup-content-wrapper {
  backgound-color: #666;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
.leaflet-popup-content-wrapper .leaflet-popup-content {
  margin: 15px 30px 15px 20px;
}
.leaflet-popup-content-wrapper h4 {
  color: #fff;
  font-family: "nyt-franklin", arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
  font-size: 20px;
  font-weight: 700;
  line-height: 1.2;
  margin: 0 0 5px;
  -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
  -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
}
.leaflet-popup-content-wrapper h5 {
  color: #fff;
  font-family: "nyt-franklin", arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
  font-size: 16px;
  font-weight: 200;
  margin: 0 0 20px;
}
.g-popup-happy .leaflet-popup-content-wrapper,
.g-popup-happy .leaflet-popup-tip {
  background-color: #e05a60;
}
.g-popup-sad .leaflet-popup-content-wrapper,
.g-popup-sad .leaflet-popup-tip {
  background-color: #554b8d;
}
.leaflet-label {
  background: #ebebeb;
  background: rgba(235, 235, 235, 0.81);
  background-clip: padding-box;
  border-color: #777;
  border-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25);
  border-radius: 4px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-width: 4px;
  color: #111;
  display: block;
  font: 12px/20px "Helvetica Neue", Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 1px 6px;
  position: absolute;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  pointer-events: none;
  white-space: nowrap;
  z-index: 6;
}
.leaflet-label.leaflet-clickable {
  cursor: pointer;
  pointer-events: auto;
}
.leaflet-label:before,
.leaflet-label:after {
  border-top: 6px solid transparent;
  border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
  content: none;
  position: absolute;
  top: 5px;
}
.leaflet-label:before {
  border-right: 6px solid black;
  border-right-color: inherit;
  left: -10px;
}
.leaflet-label:after {
  border-left: 6px solid black;
  border-left-color: inherit;
  right: -10px;
}
.leaflet-label-right:before,
.leaflet-label-left:after {
  content: "";
}

                                <p>
                                    My then boyfriend desperately wanted to show me Fort Tryon & Inwood parks that he explored as a teen. I gave him a hug to say hello and apologize for the 1 train, and we spent the next 5 hours talking as we rambled from the Pier 1 Cafe(excellent view) to the Boat Basin(rowdy crowd) to a restaurant for dinner. His was not my only first date at the Pier 1 Cafe, but it was certainly the best, I married him!",

            "emotion":"happy"

We let the sound wash over us, threw the pillows around, made forts, and made out. It was a great weird New York date. ",

            "blurb":"We met through mutual friends at a music festival in Pennsylvania.  I thought he was weird.  I still wanted to see him again.  He brought me to Governor's Island, took my hand, pulled me towards him, and kissed me.  We've been in love ever since.",

We met and quickly discovered we were at same college in the 70s, shared some close friends but had never heard of the other!  Having been so vetted, we have been together ever since...five years and, oh, who's counting?!",

Google maps led us to the only open business--Dunkin Donuts. "So...this isn't working," he began.             "place":"We Found Love in a Strange Place  ",
            "blurb":"He was skeptical of this weird Chinatown gem but the bar's random music and cheap beer won him over. 5 hours later, we stumbled outdoors into the pouring summer storm where we had the most movie-moment-esque kiss I've ever had. It became our favorite bar. ",

            "blurb":"I've been on quite a few dates before and not once have I had a good date with someone who goes to school at Columbia University. Ms. Smolenski and Mr. De Rosa in June, just above the spot approaching the Williamsburg Bridge where he had an accident hours after meeting her in 2012.

100000003745374.headline: Tell Us Your New York Summer Love Story
100000003745374.summary: For a series on Summer Love, The Times is looking for New York City summer love stories, both good and bad, to share with readers.

caption.full: Lisa Guerrera and Rich O’Flanagan discovered a mutual love for roller coasters.

interactivegraphics.freeformbody:
Do you have a story of summer love in New York City? It may have been decades ago but feels like yesterday. (Or maybe it was yesterday.) It lasted, or maybe it didn't. We want your stories -- the ones romantics dream about, couples happily retell or ex-couples cringe over.

A team of editors will read the submissions for possible publication at the end of the season. There are four guidelines:

      1. It took place in New York City.
      2. It happened in summer.
      3. It is suitable for a family newspaper.
      4. It should be 400 words or less.

An editor will follow up with you if your story is chosen.

Deadline: July 31, 2015

To submit your story, we need the following information:

You have 400 words left.

Select your image

By submitting to us, you are promising that the content is original, doesn’t plagiarize from anyone or infringe a copyright or trademark, doesn’t violate anybody’s rights and isn’t libelous or otherwise unlawful or misleading. You are agreeing that we can use your submission in all manner and media of The New York Times and that we shall have the right to authorize third parties to do so. And you agree to the rules of our Member Agreement, found online at our website.

Thank you for your submission.

100000003747585.headline: The Roller Coaster Couple
100000003747585.summary: A passion for the thrilling rides is one of the few things that college students Lisa Guerrera and Rich O’Flanagan have in common, other than love.

caption.full: When they met, she said, she did not really like him.

100000003749954.headline: Love and Roller Coasters
100000003749954.summary: Lisa Guerrera and Rich O’Flanagan both speak the language of roller coasters, an inside joke that brings sweet memories of their romance’s earliest beginnings.

caption.full: Lisa Guerrera, 19, and Rich O’Flanagan, 21, at Coney Island.
